author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Police arrest 4 after 9-year-old boy dies weighing 15 pounds
text:
An Indiana Sheriff compared photos from a crime scene where a 15-pound boy starved to death to images from Auschwitz.
Officers just before 4 a.m. on Tuesday arrived at a home in Northern Vigo County in response to a call that 9-year-old Cameron Hoopingarner was in cardiac arrest, Fox 59 reported .
Cameron was taken to Union Hospital where he was pronounced dead. Doctors said he weighed only 15 pounds when he died.
“His cause of death was severe malnutrition, and the manner was homicide as ruled preliminarily by the coroner’s office,” Sheriff Greg Ewing said during a press conference. “Essentially in my opinion, he was starved to death.”
The boy was also blind and suffered from cerebral palsy.
“It makes me mad, makes me mad that somebody could do this to a child, let alone a child that has physical handicaps and was blind ... was given to a guardian to take care of. And this is how he gets treated?” Ewing said. “This is what he deserves? To be starved to death? What kind of animals are they?”
Following an investigation, officers arrested Chad Kraemer, 33, Hubert Kraemer, 56, Robin Kraemer, 53, and 30-year-old Sarah Travioli, the news station reported.
The group lived together in the house on Lewsader Avenue where Hubert and Robin Kraemer acted as Cameron’s gaurdians, Ewing said.
Two other children — ages 5 and 3, belonging to Chad Kraemer and Travioli — were removed from the house by the Department of Child Services, the Tribune Star reported.
All four were charged with neglect of a dependent resulting in death and neglect of a dependent. Chad Kraemer and Travioli were additionally charged with failure to report child neglect.
All of the suspects were being held in the Vigo County Jail in lieu of $250,000 bond and were slated to appear in court on Thursday.
